mainmatter.p: A denotational semantics for a programming language is called fully abstract if the notion of semantic equality that it induces coincides with the notion of observational equivalence in the language. In other words, we have \llbracket t_1 \rrbracket = \llbracket t_2 \rrbracket \ \leftrightarrow \ t_1 \equiv t_2, where \equiv denotes observational equivalence.
